DataElement.preferredName: Additional Embolization Or Ablation Therapeutic Procedure Post Recurrent Disease Performed Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text indicator to signify whether or not additional ablation or embolization was performed to treat the new tumor event.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Additional Embolization Or Ablation Therapeutic Procedure Post Recurrent Disease Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Added; extra. (from American Heritage Dictionary)_(EM-bo-lih-ZAY-shun) The blocking of an artery by a clot or foreign material. Embolization can be done as treatment to block the flow of blood to a tumor._Or; used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Removal of a part, pathway, or function by surgery, chemical destruction, electrocautery, or radiofrequency. (Taber's)_An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process._Post; occuring after._the return of a sign, symptom, or disease after a remission._Performed; carried out.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Additional Embolization Therapy Or Ablation Therapeutic Procedure
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Added; extra. (from American Heritage Dictionary):(EM-bo-lih-ZAY-shun) The blocking of an artery by a clot or foreign material. Embolization can be done as treatment to block the flow of blood to a tumor.:Or; used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Removal of a part, pathway, or function by surgery, chemical destruction, electrocautery, or radiofrequency. (Taber's):An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: A procedure in which substances are injected into blood vessels adjacent to a tumor for the purpose of interrupting the blood flow to the cancer cells.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Removal, separation, detachment, extirpation, or eradication of a body part, pathway, or function by surgery, chemical destruction, morbid process, or noxious substance.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Property.preferredDefinition: Post; occuring after.:the return of a sign, symptom, or disease after a remission.:Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
The return of a disease after a period of remission.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Curated for The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA) by request of T. Lichtenberg 12/2010 sw

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator of Yes, No, or Unknown to represent a condition.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.29 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. ak

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ReferenceDocuments.description: Additional Treatment of New Tumor Event Ablation/Embolization Therapy

ReferenceDocuments.description: If yes, complete ablation/embolization therapy supplemental form
